snippet: A handful of papers won’t run this week’s series, while several others will move the strips from the comics to opinion pages or Web sites only.
abstract: Handful of newspapers will not run series of Garry Trudeau's Doonesbury comic strip, which uses graphic imagery to lampoon a Texas law requiring women to have an ultrasound before an abortion; several other newspapers will publish the strip on their editorial pages, in hopes of avoiding ire from readers.
lead_paragraph: A handful of papers won’t run this week’s series, while several others will move the strips from the comics to opinion pages or Web sites only.

headline.seo: ‘Doonesbury’ Strip on Abortion Rankles Some Newspapers
